item.title: Maths Help
item.dc:creator: @_DEAD *DEAD*
item.description:
@_DEAD wrote:

triganomic functions are basically rations between parts of a circle. Since you seem to have little idea what your talking about, ill assume your working with right angle triangles.

the sine of an angle (sin) is equal to the leg (side) opposite or not touching the angle divided by the hypotnuse of the right angle (the long side)

the cosine of an angle (cos) is equal to the leg ajacent or touching the angle divided by the hyponuse

the tangent of an angle (tan) is equal to the opposite side divided by the opposite leg divided by the ajacent leg

there are also other functions such as cotangent (cot), seculant (sec), coseculant (csc), versine, haversine and one more i cant remember. If you need explaining on these (you wont trust me) ill explain them.

Read full topic
